project.teaser: Regional railway (lines with lower usage or secondary network) plays a crucial role not only in serving European regions, but also as feeders for passenger and freight traffic for the main/core network. Therefore, they have an essential function as an environmentally friendly...
project.objective: Regional railway (lines with lower usage or secondary network) plays a crucial role not only in serving European regions, but also as feeders for passenger and freight traffic for the main/core network. Therefore, they have an essential function as an environmentally friendly mode of transport. In addition is as well essential their link to other public transport services (e.g. bus) and to first and last mile services, such as bikesharing, cycling, walking or driving to get from/to stations to remote locations. Unfortunately, many of these routes were abandoned in the past - mainly due to high costs. Therefore, these rail lines need to be revitalized or even renewed to make them economically, socially and environmentally sustainable and to meet current customer needs and challenges The overall objectives of the FutuRe project are to ensure the long-term viability of the regional railway by reducing the total cost of ownership (TCO), while ensuring high service quality and operational reliability. It also aims to increase customer satisfaction and to make rail an attractive and preferred mode of transport. Therefore, the main objectives of FutuRe are: lowering CAPEX system costs, increasing productivity by lowering OPEX (unit costs per train kilometre), and improving customer satisfaction. These goals are to be achieved through a concept tailored to regional railways but transferable across Europe, encompassing digitalisation, automation and the use of common and new technologies for signalling and track components, rolling stock and customer information. Cost drivers such as infrastructure and energy components, e.g. trackside train detection (axle counters, etc.) and level crossing control systems, will be replaced by less costly wireless and energy-autonomous components. In addition, a modular and standardised vehicle concept specifically tailored to the requirements of regional lines becomes needed, as well as a range of attractive services.
project.title: Europe’s Rail Flagship Project 6 - Delivering Innovative rail services to revitalise capillary lines and Regional rail services
project.keywords: Regional Railway, CCS & Operations, Rolling Stock, Railway Infrastructure Assets, Railway Services, Cost efficient railway

article.title: Innovative services for sustainable regional railway

result.title: IET Intelligent Transport Systems

details.authors: Patrick Urassa; Nils O. E. Olsson; Albert Lau; Pranjal Mandhaniya; Bjørn Andersen

result.title: Evaluating Deep Learning Advances for Point Cloud Semantic Segmentation in Urban Environments

details.authors: Hailun Yan; Albert Lau; Hongchao Fan
details.journalTitle: KN - Journal of Cartography and Geographic Information

result.title: Requirement specification for services in regional lines (Alpha Release)
result.description: This deliverable will provide:•Specification of functional and non-functional requirements of use cases and test cases are; •A testing strategy for tests future tests/demonstrators.

result.title: State-of-the Art Report for regional lines rolling stock
result.description: This deliverable will provide: •A comprehensive report on requirement specification for rolling stock with a particular focus on mechanical architecture, mechanical parts, TCMS, traction/propulsion, modular interior, and train control as well as a first concept-paper for a fuelling station;•Suggestions on legislative changes/TSI updates (LOCPAS, CCS, OPE) including operational and functional needs;•A first concept for a lightweight, emission free rolling stock with modular interior.

result.title: Requirements and interface design for TMS-PIS
result.description: This deliverable will provide:•An analysis of requirements and description of a complete interface design for TMS and PIS. •Definition of use-cases which are the base for test cases and demonstrations.

result.title: Technical specifications for using regional lines for freight services
result.description: This deliverable will provide:•Description of technical specifications of tools enabling the integration of the first and last mile of freight delivery under specific conditions of regional lines.

result.title: Specifications CCS for Group 2
result.description: This deliverable will provide:•Detailed System Architecture description including interface description and functions allocated in all modules;•Alignment and accepted deviations (if any) from the European TSIs; •Functional and non-functional requirements;•List and characteristic of involved COTS.

result.title: Use cases and scenarios for ETCS L3 demos on G1 regional lines
result.description: This deliverable will provide:•Use Cases and scenarios (per company involved);•Compendium of Use Cases and Scenarios (unique, gathering all the above) – integration of individual inputs, finding gaps and overlaps, to provide a consolidated and complete list of unique Use Cases/Scenarios, which allow to perform the demonstrators more efficiently.

result.title: Specification of Passenger congestion monitoring
result.description: This deliverable will provide:•Specification of a model including data sets, data sources and algorithms to dilute congestions on stations.

result.title: Use cases and scenarios for Cost-effective fail-safe on-board train integrity & train length demos on G1 regional lines
result.description: This deliverable will provide: •Use Cases and Scenarios (per company involved);•Compendium of use cases and scenarios (unique, gathering all the use cases and scenarios per company) – integration of individual inputs, finding gaps and overlaps, to provide a consolidated and complete list of unique Use Cases/Scenarios, which will allow to perform the task 3.11.2 more efficiently.

result.title: Investigation of standards in Public Transport and gap analysis (Alpha Release)
result.description: This deliverable will provide:•Analysis of existing standards and description of gaps that need to be closed in respect to new requirements.

result.title: Use cases and scenarios for ATO in different GoA demos for G1 regional lines
result.description: This deliverable will provide:•Use cases and scenarios (per company involved);•Compendium of use cases and scenarios (unique, gathering use cases and scenarios per company– integration of individual inputs, finding gaps and overlaps, to provide a consolidated and complete list of unique use cases/scenarios, which allow to perform the demonstrators more efficiently.

result.title: Requirement specifications for Wayside Assets Report
result.description: This deliverable will provide:•A comprehensive report on functional and non-functional requirements of wayside assets.

result.title: Project dissemination and communication plan
result.description: The Communication and dissemination plan will be produced outlining the target audiences, including stakeholder mapping. It would design key messages and specific channels, timing schedule, and partners roles and responsibilities. It will include the project visual identity and website. It consists of the project’s website, to communicate, inform, create dialogue and promote use of the project results among the target stakeholder groups [First version of this plan produced in M6; updated versions of the plan produced in M24 and final in M48].

result.title: Specification of Multimodal Travel Solution (Final Release)
result.description: This deliverable will provide:An UML based specification for Multimodal Travel Solutions; A list of functions to be developed in WP 11.

result.title: First release of KPI achievement
result.description: This report will contain the demonstration of the KPI achievement. There are two steps for this deliverable: describing the specific metrics and methods to measure and achieve impacts of the project and the correlation with the impact areas.;present the first release of KPI assessment and contribution to the expected EU-Rail impacts

result.title: Use cases and scenarios for Traffic Management Systems demos on G1 regional lines - Collaborative Deliverables
result.description: This deliverable will provide: •Use Cases and scenarios (per company involved);•Compendium of Use cases and scenarios (unique, use cases and scenarios per company) – integration of individual inputs, finding gaps and overlaps, to provide a consolidated and complete list of unique use cases/scenarios, which allow to perform the demonstrators.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - FP6 - FutuRe (Europe’s Rail Flagship Project 6 - Delivering Innovative rail services to revitalise capillary lines and Regional rail services)
result.teaser: Regional railway (lines with lower usage or secondary network) plays a crucial role not only in serving European regions, but also as feeders for passenger and freight traffic for the main/core network. Therefore, they have an essential function as an environmentally friendly...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Specification of Multimodal Travel Solution (Alpha Release)
result.description: This deliverable will provide:•The scope of collaboration with Destination 1; •A list of functions to be developed in WP 11.

result.title: Specification of demand analysis algorithms
result.description: This deliverable will provide:•Specification of AI based long term and short-term travel demands under the specific view of regional lines.

result.title: Requirements and definitions on Data Bases for Regional Lines (Alpha Release)
result.description: This deliverable will provide:•Review and description of existing data bases; •Descriptions of requirements with a specific focus on regional lines and definitions.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
